009package imagingbook.lib.ij;
010
011import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
012import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
013
014/**
015 * Utility methods for filtering images. 
016 * None of the filter methods modifies the kernel, i.e., kernels are 
017 * used as supplied and never normalized.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2020-02-19
021 */
022public abstract class Filter {
023
024        /**
025         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
026         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in horizontal direction only.#
027         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
028         * 
029         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
030         * @param h the filter kernel
031         */
032        public static void convolveX (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
033                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
034                conv.setNormalize(false);
035                conv.convolve(fp, h, h.length, 1);
036        }
037
038        /**
039         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
040         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in vertical direction only.
041         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
042         * 
043         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
044         * @param h the filter kernel
045         */
046        public static void convolveY (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
047                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
048                conv.setNormalize(false);
049                conv.convolve(fp, h, 1, h.length);
050        }
051
052        /**
053         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
054         * which is modified.
055         * The 1D kernel is applied twice, once in horizontal and once in
056         * vertical direction.
057         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
058         * 
059         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
060         * @param h the filter kernel
061         */
062        public static void convolveXY (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
063                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
064                conv.setNormalize(false);
065                conv.convolve(fp, h, h.length, 1);
066                conv.convolve(fp, h, 1, h.length);
067        }
068
069}
